notes: Weather instrument for measuring atmospheric pressure

examples.japanese: この気圧計が壊れてなかったら、雨がいつ止むかわかるんじゃない?
examples.english: If this barometer wasn't broken, wouldn't we know when the rain will stop?

notes: Can refer to wind, rain, or both

examples.japanese: 突然の嵐にあってしまいました
examples.english: They encountered a sudden storm

examples.japanese: 気圧計をニョロニョロに返したほうがいい
examples.english: We should return the barometer to the Hattifatteners

examples.japanese: 確かに珍しい植物は見つけた
examples.english: I certainly found rare plants

examples.japanese: 綱を結ばなかったんですか?
examples.english: You didn't tie the rope?

examples.japanese: 結んであったよ
examples.english: It was tied

examples.japanese: 今は満潮なんだ
examples.english: It must be high tide now

notes: Can refer to both sound and flash

examples.japanese: 雷の音も聞こえないわ
examples.english: I can't hear the thunder either

notes: 退屈する = to be bored

examples.japanese: ずっとテントの中で退屈したわ
examples.english: I've been bored in the tent the whole time

notes: Intransitive. 光らせる = to make shine

examples.japanese: みんな光ってる
examples.english: They're all glowing

examples.japanese: ニョロニョロたちの体は電気を帯びた
examples.english: The Hattifatteners' bodies became charged with electricity

notes: 勇気がある = to be brave

examples.japanese: ムーミンって、勇気があるのね
examples.english: Moomin is so brave

examples.japanese: あいつ、君の顔にぶつかったろ
examples.english: That thing bumped into your face, didn't it?

examples.japanese: 髪の毛なんて、またすぐに生えてくるわ
examples.english: Hair will grow back soon

examples.japanese: そんなに心配することないのよ
examples.english: You don't need to worry so much

examples.japanese: ひどいわ、ひどいわ
examples.english: It's terrible, terrible!

examples.japanese: 髪の毛なんて、またすぐに生えてくるわ
examples.english: Hair will grow back soon

examples.japanese: 誰にも決して見つからない秘密の島
examples.english: A secret island that no one will ever find

examples.japanese: 二度と見たくないね
examples.english: I never want to see them again

meaning: to suit, to look good on

examples.japanese: そのスカーフ、とってもよく似合うよ
examples.english: That scarf looks really good on you

examples.japanese: ママに借りたの
examples.english: I borrowed it from Mama

examples.japanese: 島の探検もゆっくりできるぞ
examples.english: We can take our time exploring the island

meaning: to wash ashore, to drift ashore

examples.japanese: いろいろなものが流れ着いている
examples.english: Various things have washed ashore

examples.japanese: 宝石なんか、流れ着いてないかしら
examples.english: I wonder if any jewels have washed ashore

examples.japanese: 空っぽだ
examples.english: It's empty!

notes: Also read ほうもつ in formal contexts

examples.japanese: すごい宝物を見つけた
examples.english: I found an amazing treasure

examples.japanese: 船で使う望遠鏡だよ
examples.english: It's a telescope used on ships

examples.japanese: 面白いものがあるぞ
examples.english: There's something interesting!

notes: Only godan verb ending in ぬ

examples.japanese: 死んでるの?
examples.english: Is she dead?

examples.japanese: 初めから生きてはいない
examples.english: She was never alive to begin with

examples.japanese: 大きな船の先についていた飾り
examples.english: A decoration that was attached to a large ship

examples.japanese: 助けてくれ、誰か助けて
examples.english: Help me! Someone help!

examples.japanese: どうしてこんなところへ落っこちたんですか?
examples.english: Why did you fall into a place like this?

examples.japanese: あの木の女王様が好きになってしまって
examples.english: He fell in love with that wooden queen

examples.japanese: このガラス玉をあげるよ
examples.english: I'll give you this glass ball

examples.japanese: ムーミン一家の船の旅
examples.english: The Moomin family's boat trip

notes: 旅行 is more common in modern Japanese

examples.japanese: 船の旅はこんな風にして終わりました
examples.english: The boat trip came to an end like this

examples.japanese: 大勢のお客様が僕の家にやってきた
examples.english: A lot of guests came to my house

examples.japanese: 彼らは一体何者なんだろう?
examples.english: Who on earth are they?
